title: Spouses could be owed more than £1,000 from HMRC – claim now before it's too late
text:
Have you been married for at least five years? If so, you could be due a refund of more than £1,000 from HM Revenue & Customs.

The marriage allowance allows spouses or civil partners to pass on up to £1,250 of their tax-free personal allowance – currently £12,500 – to their other half, cutting their partner’s tax bill by as much as £250 a year.

To qualify, the partner passing on their allowance must be a non-taxpayer, while the receiver must be a basic-rate taxpayer.

It is particularly useful for families in which one partner takes time out of work to bring up children.
